usefulItems: cling film, quiche or tart tin (Ø 25 cm), rolling pin, baking paper, baking beans, fine sieve, pastry brush, refrigerator, oven
title: Smoked Haddock and Spinach Tart

ingredients.content: 200 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
50 g Cheddar cheese, cut in pieces

preparations.content: Place flour, salt and butter in mixing bowl then chop <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add milk and pulse <b>Turbo/1 sec/2-4 times<b> until just clinging together. Tip out, wrap in cling film and chill in fridge for 30-40 minutes.
On a lightly floured surface, roll pastry out thinly (3 mm), then place pastry in a loose bottomed tart tin (Ø 25 cm). Chill in fridge for 20 minutes. Meanwhile preheat oven to 160°C.
Line tart with baking paper and fill with baking beans. Bake for 15 minutes (160°C). Remove baking paper and beans and return to oven for 10 minutes (160°C). Meanwhile prepare filling.
Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert simmering basket and weigh in haddock. Add milk, pouring it over to just cover fish, then poach <b>12 min/98°C/speed 1<b>.
Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula then set aside. Strain milk through a sieve into a bowl and set aside to cool. Clean mixing bowl.
Place onions, oil and butter in mixing bowl and sauté <b>8 min/120°C//speed 0.5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place water and spinach in mixing bowl then cook <b>3 min/100°C/speed 2<b>, stirring with spatula through hole in mixing bowl lid.  Drain water from mixing bowl and discard, then chop spinach <b>1 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer spinach to a sieve and set aside to drain.
Lightly beat 1 egg white and brush all over part-baked pastry case then bake for further 5 minutes (160°C).
Flake cooked haddock into pastry case. Add reserved cheese, onions and spinach and spread mixture out evenly.
Place 100 g poaching milk, eggs and remaining egg yolk, cream, salt and pepper in mixing bowl then mix <b>7 sec/speed 5<b>. Pour into tart case to just below tart rim.
Bake in oven for 45-55 minutes (160°C) until golden and lightly set in the middle. Serve warm or cold with a dressed salad.
